Take a piece of flax soaked in water and place it on the wound, and work it into the mouth of the cavity, and wash out the mouth with that; and do not let any cause make you remove from there anything else and change the water every hour with its own hand, for as soon as the leech feels the water it will bite.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not possible to perform what we have recommended with this, then fumigate the wound with cimex or asafetida by means of the instrument which we have described for the fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so that it may fall out.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another method of operation in fumigation of this, which is that you take an urn in which are burning coals and the urn is covered with a cover in the middle of which is a hole, and attach the end of the instrument to that hole; and then proceed above for the fumigation; and place the wound over the mouth of the tube, and close it so that the fumigation does not escape until you know that the fumigation has reached the leech, for the leech will immediately fall out.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not bite, then proceed with the fumigation as many times as necessary, and prevent the patient from drinking, and give causes that are salty and dry, and let them not drink water, and in this way it is necessary for this regimen to be followed.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which the leech is removed from the body when it is seen; and it resembles forceps as you see, but there is some curvature to it:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed in the joint, and its extremity resembles the beak of a stork, which is a kind of claw, on which there are grooves, so that when it presses upon any cause, it does not slip.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the discourse on the preparation for abscesses and their incision.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are various types of swellings, in many ways, as will be recalled for each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they differ in their puncture and incision by two methods, of which one is according to the nature of the abscess itself; and by what presses upon the humidity.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is according to the locations where they occur in the body, for an abscess occurring in the head is different from one occurring in the buttocks; and an abscess occurring in a fleshy part is different from one occurring in a joint; and each has its treatment by surgical operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And there are some abscesses that should not be punctured but left until the pus has properly matured or they have reached completion.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	There are other abscesses that should be treated when they are crosswise and not properly matured, such as those near joints, for when an abscess is near a joint, its nature extends around it until you can reach what is inside it, and if the ligaments or nerves of that joint become corrupted because of it, it becomes a cause of contraction of that member; or if it is near a principal limb, and if you delay puncturing it before it has matured, it may harm the principal limb; or if it is near the buttocks, then puncture it when it is not fully matured; but do not puncture it raw, without proper digestion, except what is near the buttocks, so that you do not leave behind pus which can extend to deeper parts of the buttocks and cause a fistula, or that it be done in such a way that it cannot heal.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	May it be known that you should know the time for piercing the abscess, and this is when it is ripe.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you should know that it is ripe when there is a reduction in pain and the cessation of fever, and soon after a decrease in redness and pulsation, and the sharpness at the head of the abscess, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And you should know that the piercing should be done in the place where the pus is below the abscess and comes from the highest part of the swelling.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the piercing should always be done along the length of the flesh or body if the abscesses are in parts like the limbs or joints, and in places away from veins, tendons, nerves, arteries; and finally, in all places equal to those where there is no reflection; for in those that do reflect, use piercing according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in a fleshy place, the best time is to delay the piercing until the second stage of digestion is confirmed, as we have said; for if you pierce it before that, it prolongs the suffering of the patient and increases corruption, and makes the lips of the abscess hardened and its depth greater.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses should be pierced according to the width of the flesh or body due to necessity, or according to what the limb requires.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you should administer a small piercing, and in large abscesses, a larger and wider piercing or multiple sections according to the diversity of the size of the abscesses.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And other abscesses in which the treatment should be hollowed out and cut open, when it is done as if with bread dough and is performed at a time when it is ready, just as occurs with those that happen from excessive debility and buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those which are incised with a section having three angles; and of those is in which it is incised as the figure of a myrtle leaf, as the abscesses of the fingers.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of those in which round section and lunar section are administered, similar to these.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But in the case where there is none such as their superficial lion abscesses, it is necessary that you pierce it with a superficial puncture, or simply scrape it.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the abscess is large and has already collected pus and unhealthy matter, you should pierce it but do not hesitate to extract all the pus at that time; having extracted one part from it, on another day scrape the abscess inside, and then extract a larger part, and continue doing this several times according to its degree of inflammation.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is a young man, or pregnant woman, or small child, or elderly in debility, for the animal spirit's many visits are resolved with the evacuation of the pus, and the patient easily recovers, and you will heal them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Therefore, guard this chapter with great caution, and after your puncture in which you pierce these abscesses, it is necessary that you cleanse the wounds and then consider whether the wound of the abscess is small or if it is a flat section; at that time administer some of them with lint or old cloth. And if the abscess is large and the cracks of the puncture are many, then it is necessary that you place wax in each groove until they heal together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess a part of the cord has been cut or has become concave around it, then you should fill it with old cloth or thread made from linen, as when you treat ulcers or roots without moisture; and strengthen that on the third day; and afterwards proceed with it and care for it according to what is needed of ointments until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	If blood flows during the time of your operation, then at that hour administer water mixed with vinegar in which you dip a cloth, and place that over the site of the bleeding for several times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	If the bleeding persists, then you should administer treatment and cure as well as powders which I have recommended in various places of this our book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	If it is in the time of winter, and the site of the abscess is a place with many nerves, then you should administer powders mixed with vinegar and hot oil, and apply those to the sites.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in summer, and the sites are fleshy, then you should apply powders soaked in water and oil or in vinegar and oil, and keep this moistened until the third day, as we have said, and then you should open the abscess and clean it and administer to its cure what it needs until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the knowledge of the cure of abscesses generally, but according to the method of distinction I have already said about each abscess in what manner is the way of its cure separately by chapters.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On the section of abscesses which appear in the neck.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the neck of the head, small abscesses appear, and they are of various types of knots that contain membranes; and their types vary.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And they are soft, and those contain moisture similar to jelly.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	Of those things which contain humidity like dust, and similar to them; and of those things which are stony, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all, and in the extraction of those there is no fear, as you should know that the extraction of those does not contradict the art of surgery.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the section of those is that you express them with an instrument whose form approaches this, which is called an entremes, until you know what it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what it contains is humidity, then you should cut it with a section according to its length by making a superficial section according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin the section from the line of .B. to the line of .G. Then, as the humidity is evacuated, you should remove the skin that contains this moisture, and do not leave any part of it behind, for if any part remains, it may lead to further issues returning.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then submerge a piece of lint in Egyptian ointment if it is available, and if not, in water and salt; and fill the wound with this and leave it for another day, for this will dissolve everything that remains of that membrane.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then apply the lint again with Egyptian ointment a second and third time if necessary, until you are confident that there is no remaining part of that membrane; now treat the wound with ointment until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if an abscess contains hard nodules, then you should incise it according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	This is a cross-shaped incision, and place the point of your instrument between two lips of the incision and scrape it all around, and exert your strength in extracting the membrane which contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	If your surgery encounters difficulties, now do what I have first recounted to you.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly proceed with the incision and treatment of the abscess as we have told you; and an incision on a calcified abscess is easier, because it contains little blood and little moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are cases of abscesses in the head in some people who do not have much moisture throughout; the reason for this is that I once incised an abscess on an old woman's head and found it as hard as a stone, rough, white, and could not be extracted, and if anyone were to strike it with force, it would injure them.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	However, in other abscesses that occur in the head, this is not the case of this chapter; likewise, for abscesses that appear on infants' heads and behind their ears, the incision should be superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And avoid piercing those in the lower region because it would cause the pus to flow to the lower parts of the body.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And treat those accordingly as is appropriate for such cases.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter XLII.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the incision of scrofulas which occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Often these abscesses appear in the neck and armpits; and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck, and such as are generated between them, and all scrofula of those is within its own proper sheath, and likewise as in the knots and abscesses of the head, as we have recounted.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the kinds of these scrofulas are knots, for some of those are lithic, and among those which contain moisture, and among those are malignant ones which do not respond to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in that one which you find to be well disposed during the examination, whose color is similar to that of the skin, and is soft throughout, and is not attached to the neck nerves or veins, and does not protrude, ensure that you incise it at the surface layer of the area above and below the middle line of .G. within the line of .B., and peel it off entirely from all sides, extending the edges of the skin to one inch, or more inches if necessary, as we have said regarding abscesses of the head, and extract it bit by bit.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is best to be cautious not to incise the vein or nerve.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the spatula not be sharp, so that it does not disturb your hand during incision or cause pain to the patient, and do not incise what is not necessary; for if you were to cut a vein or artery and prohibit yourself from continuing the operation, then apply a salve of vitriol trissect or other powders that promote blood flow, and staunch the wound. Let it remain inside until the acuteness of the abscess subsides and the swelling is mollified and begins to soften.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is cut off.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore return to your operation after you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire of the patient whether there is any cause for the other small scrophules, therefore incise those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if there is a large vein at the root of the large scrophula, be careful not to incise that scrophula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Also be careful to tie it with a strong ligature and let it fall off by itself without harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old cotton that you have already soaked in Egyptian oil, and then dress it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you incise the scrophula completely, then be careful to approximate the two lips of the wound and suture them immediately so that there is no room for any superfluity.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is excessive superfluity due to the size of the scrophula, then be careful to incise its root, and evacuate it and administer sutures as mentioned.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for the scrophulas that contain humidity, pierce them with a shallow incision where the place of maturation appears to you, and do not penetrate deeper into what might cause pus formation in the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer an incision, wash it with appropriate ointment and similar preparations, so that it corrodes what is left of the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	When you see that the wound is cleansed, then you cure it by applying fresh flesh that has been generated.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XLIII.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On the incision of the pustule of the abscess within the armpit.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients called this incision an epilhot, but I have not seen anyone in our region perform this procedure.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of their speech.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in cases where men have scrofula, it should be avoided to perform the extraction of the epilhot, as it is not beneficial because all the veins and major vessels are affected here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have boils that occur in the mouth or armpit or ears, when the illness is not in the bone, it is advisable to use the incision of the epilhot to avoid the damage caused by puncture.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want to do this, the epilhot should be incised below three circles of the epilhot's circles, or four if it is a small incision along its length between two circles in quantity. The incision should be made in the ciphac, not in the cartilage, and this location is suitable for incision because it lacks flesh and the blood vessels are close to the surface.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the physician is cautious, he should then extend the arm of the armpit and proceed to cut along it until he reaches the canal, but avoid the blood vessels if you see any reason to do so.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	Here is the translation:
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	If the swelling has been present for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, as the hour arrives when the puncture is feared, add two edges of the root of the swelling, and cut to where the cartilage is.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that cause the flesh to grow until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Al-Bucasis says that the essence of what we have recounted is to see that some of these abscesses have already blocked the passage of the patient's breath, and the patient has come within reach of death, and the airway is cut off, and some will incise the epiglottis so that the patient can breathe over the site of the swelling for a short time, and thus be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And by this command the swelling should be left open until the malignity of the illness is consumed; and the malignity lasts for three days; therefore, at that time the command is to treat the swelling, and care for it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen myself is that a servant took a knife and cut into their own throat, severing part of the windpipe, and I was called to treat them. Upon arrival, I found the wound as it would be in someone near death, and discovered the swelling and saw the blood that had come from the swelling.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I confessed that she had not cut any vein or artery, and the air was coming from the swelling, and I treated her until she was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And the servant did not suffer any harm except for hoarseness in her voice, and after some days she returned to improvement in her condition.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	Here I say that in the section of the episiotomy there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the section on abscess which occurs in the groin area, and is called hernia of the groin.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess called hernia of the groin is large according to the size of the body, and it occurs in females.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it happens in two ways, for it is either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural case, there is no need for treatment.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental one happens in two ways, one of which is similar to fatty knots, and the other way is similar to an abscess caused by arterial obstruction, and in that case there is cause for fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And one should not attempt to treat it with iron unless it is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you should proceed cautiously and investigate it as described. If you find it similar to fatty knots and not attached to any veins, then incise it as you would with nodes, and extract it with water that contains the skin and bursiclam; if not, thoroughly examine its nature, and subsequently treat the area as appropriate for internal treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLV.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the section on types of knots.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are various types of knots, and I have already described all their types in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	Here is the translation:
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Thus I say that with evacuation there is heat and fever and violent pains until the ebullition of the superfluity ceases; and it completes putrefaction when then the fever, pain, and heat cease.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But now there is no heat nor fever nor pain, and continue that regimen which is appropriate for one who has had an evacuation.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it depends on the color of the skin, and its beginning is like a pimple and is formed as if it were voided, whether larger or smaller, and they are of two kinds, either dry or fatty and contain moisture, and the colors of the moisture vary, as I say in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you arrive at the treatment of this condition, express that and inquire about it at the beginning concerning the disturbance which is called an intercurrent disease, as its form will come in the chapter which is near to this one.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And this is the method of inquiry for abscesses and all nodes, which is that you take this probe and insert it into the most humid part of the location which you find in the abscess, and you will move your fingers little by little until you know that the probe has already penetrated the tissue.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And then withdraw it gradually according to the measure of the size of the abscess, and then extract what has been inserted and observe what comes out in its wake.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the flowing moisture, of whatever color it may be, is expelled, then you shall incise it at a superficial section as I have said regarding other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if from the trace of the probe there is no moisture, then you know that it is dry.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And draw upon the dry part in a cross shape according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	As you have been taught, suspend that part and shave the wound all around with ease, and preserve the skin or sac if possible over it and extract that pus from the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is ruptured during the operation, it is not possible to extract that pus, and you should proceed carefully with this knowledge, and then you extract it in pieces so that none of it remains for any reason.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if any of it remains for any reason, little or much, the node will return accordingly.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that any part of it remains, then complete the treatment with some caustic powders and strengthen the wound, and place on that which is an abscess a cautery, and cure that by another method until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if the node is large, then you should cut both sides of it and cure that with what promotes healing.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if a pulsating vein or non-pulsating vein is opposite it, then you should cauterize and fill the place with triply refined vitriol and leave that open for two days or three until the wound becomes cleaner and the blood stops boiling; then return to cutting what remains of the node.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter XLVI.
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	On the forms of the instruments necessary for surgery and puncture.

E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	And they make probes, thick ones, lions (likely referring to a specific tool shape), as well as large needles like those used for sewing sails, which are made of citron wood, or horn, or iron, or silver. E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And some of them have hooks with two curves, and they are of three kinds.
E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And some of them have hooks with three curves, and they are of three kinds.

The extremities of those with which section is made are sharp, and the other extremities are not blunt, nor are they shaped in such a way that there is fear of cutting into a vein or nerve during the excision of nodes. And it is necessary that these kinds of ligatures be with you large, medium, and small, so that with them you can interrupt the blood flow quickly in an emergency, and at times when there is no medicine available.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	However, do not use them to interrupt the blood flow in every part of the body, and use them only in fleshy areas, such as on the tendons of the arms and legs, and on the fleshy parts of the shoulders, and on the belly and thighs, and similar to those of the fleshly tendons.

And at times these instruments are made of other small items resembling fish scales in this form; by which the blood is interrupted when it is done through phlebotomy or incision of a vein or artery.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	And some incisions are made round according to this form:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter XLVII.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	On the treatment of men's nipples, which are similar to those of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some incisions become swollen; the nipples of some men should be treated with care regarding their sleep, as they begin to harden, and then the nipples become swollen, and are similar to those of women, and we apply plasters.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And for one who desires this, you should cut those along a lunar section according to this form, from the line of B into the line of G, and then scrape off all the roughness, and then fill the wound with flesh-growing medicine, and then sew together the two edges of the wound, and care for it until it is healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the nipple inclines to the sides and is softened by its size as it does in women, then it should be cut into two parts with its pus removed, along two sections similar to a lunar figure, each of which should be contained within the other at their ends so that the larger line contains the smaller according to this form from the line B and the line G. And then scrape off the unevenness between the two edges of the wound, remove the fat, and administer what we have said about suturing and powders as necessary until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of what needs to be cut due to the restlessness of the patient and the flow of blood, then you should fill the wound with cotton submerged in a corrosive liquid and leave it until this corrodes what remains of the gristle, and then care for it until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter XLVIII.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	On the Incision of Abscesses That Are Located in the Throat.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses that occur in the throat are among the types of scrofula, hard swellings, which contain a core that can be extracted.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And among those, only some contain moisture; and those that contain moisture should be incised in a crescent shape as shown in this figure: from the line .G. to the line .B. And once all of the pus within the abscess has been evacuated, you then fill it with linen and leave it for another day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And after the linen has been left in place and the area has been treated with an appropriate ointment, it should be allowed to heal.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the abscess belongs to the types of glands or scrofula, then you should incise it as we have described in the section on scrofula.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	And if the infection has spread and there is gangrene, then you should administer cautery as we have previously described.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter XLIX.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the Incision of Abscesses That Occur Due to Artery or Vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is ruptured and the membrane covering it has become consolidated, then abscesses may occur. The signs by which it can be known that inflammation and abscess are due to the artery or vein: for when the abscess is due to an artery, it tends to form along the front of the body; and if you press on the abscess with your fingers, you will hear a rustling sound in the area.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is from a vein is round at the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And sectioning this abscess is an error, especially in those areas where the armpits are, and in the angles, and on the neck, and in many places on the body; for it is dangerous, therefore it should be avoided that its treatment may involve iron, and those that are in the extremities or on the head should also be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	In the case where it is due to inflammation of the artery opening, make an incision in the longitudinal section; and near the place where the incision should be made with hooks near the artery, and separate the tunics until it is exposed.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then place the needle there and make it penetrate into the other side, and tie the artery with a double thread at two places, which I explain in detail when extracting two arteries that are in the thighs.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then press the area between two bandages with a cloth so that the blood stops flowing entirely while it is there, and the abscess dissolves.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer treatment in which poultices are applied so that the bandages can be removed; and then treat it with appropriate ointments so that it may heal.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an abscess from the section of a vein, now you should have in your hand what is possible regarding the abscess along its longitudinal direction, and then insert the needle below the place where you had your hand, and make it penetrate; and tie a thread around it double so that you can extract it from the other side, and then ligate the abscess with a strong bandage as I have told you in the grapevine bandaging of both sides along the two extremities of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	If you fear that you will remove the thread, then at that hour insert the needle with the wax under all the abscess. You should make the insertion of the needle first, and strengthen its place in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	When the abscess is dry in its middle part and when what is inside it has come out, then you should incise the excess of the cord, and leave what is attached to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then sprinkle on the powder which you have mixed with wine and oil, and afterwards administer the treatment made with cords and herbs until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter on the abscess that occurs due to twisting of the nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as an abscess can occur in arteries and veins, similarly, an abscess occurs in the nerves when they are struck or affected by excessive labor, and for similar reasons.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is done with the needle in the areas of the joints or the heel, or in any place where the joints are painful.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a severe abscess, and its color resembles that of the surrounding tissue, and it is among the worst conditions when it is tight due to tension, and when the patient appears in a state similar to stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an abscess that aggregates in the front of the body, and for this reason it is below the cord, and it pains throughout without going to the parts before or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, what is in the joints should not be wrapped in iron, for it will quickly lead to contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	Make a cut in the head or forehead with a spatum (a surgical instrument).
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	If it is a small abscess, then cut it out with forceps and remove it by root.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then suspend it with an incision, and drain it; then apply dry dressings; and close the wound with sutures, and care for it until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 11.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	On the incision of an abscess that occurs on the lip as it would occur on the abdomen.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Therefore, for some people, there are protrusions on their abdomens and other parts of their bodies, which are called fungous because they resemble mushrooms, whose root is fine and the head of it is large; and often the edges of these are smooth, and it can be small in size, or greatly enlarged.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one case where there were two parts on his abdomen that resembled mushrooms, and there was no difference between them, they were white and had fine roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the edges of those were inverted and split open, and moisture constantly flowed from them.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, I incised them and found inside one weighing about eighteen uncias and the other about ten uncias.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the procedure in incising them is that you should consider whether the malady is moist, and if the color of the abscess is white and moist with a fine root; then you incise it with a broad spatum, and immediately in your presence cauterize it over the fire, because in such cases the section should expel much blood; and if bleeding occurs, cauterize that area.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if the wound is small and frightening, guard against making an incision with a knife; instead, take fresh lead and apply it to that place in the manner we have described; and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And then adjust it in the tightness of the lead thread; therefore, do not stop applying more lead as needed until it is firmly set and falls by itself when its work is done.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the wound is of thick tissue, there is some cause for fear and dread at its incision, especially in those that are in the abdomen.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible that you might incise half of it, and then afterward cauterize that area so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then take care of it until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to presume to incise a wound that is dark in color, has little sensation, and is easily penetrated, for such a wound is likely cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And this will come to mind as a reminder of something important regarding that.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter LII.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the Treatment of Hernia of the Navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Hernia of the navel is caused by various reasons; it may be due to fissures in the abdominal wall above the navel, and through this, either a membrane or bowel protrudes as in other ruptures; or it can be from blood that flows from veins or arteries depending on the case, or from trapped air in that area.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	If it is through a crack in the scaphoid and pus issues from the tissue, then the color of the abscess is similar to the color of the skin; it causes severe pain, and soon appears in various situations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is through the protrusion of the bowel, then its situation differs greatly from what we have recounted about other abscesses; when you press that area with your fingers, it feels concealed, and soon returns; and very lightly it is felt there, and it is magnified by means of warm baths and vigorous work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	If it is due to moisture, then it is soft and not concealed when pressed by your hand, nor is it constricted, nor is it hard.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to blood, then the abscess appears with a declining black color.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	If it is due to necrotic flesh, then the abscess is severe, large and hard, and it penetrates according to a certain quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	If it is due to gas, then the touch of it is soft.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the procedure in such cases is that you must consider whether the swelling of the navel is due to arterial blood, or venous blood, or gas; then be cautious about treating it, for there is fear and dread as I have taught you in the chapter where I discussed abscesses due to arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the swelling of the navel is due to the bowel or tissue, then you must instruct the patient to take their clothing off and stand extended; then examine around the entire navel with your hand, and then instruct them to lie down on their back; then surround the area marked by your examination around the navel with a bandage made of linen strips or cloth in an appropriate manner; then extend half of the abscess above about one inch; then bind it around the circumference firmly or loosely as is fitting.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	From the side of the abscess let the membrane be extended over the bandage and insert your finger into that pus and search for the sack; and if you have recognized or guarded it by means of the bandage, now immediately extract it and urge on the sack to the parts inside the belly.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the tissue, now take that one ounce; and cut into the excesses of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your artery or vein, now encircle that spot, and then return to your operation; and take two needles and place them in those two strong threads and insert the two needles into the circuit you have made around the abscess in a cross shape, which you should make penetrate; and then divide the abscess into four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and leave the place open so that the extended flesh can drain and fall off by itself; or incise it when it has thinned out and will drain, and then treat that area with water as needed until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the prominence of the navel is of flesh or due to moisture, now it is necessary that you conquer the abscess as we have said and extract the blood or moisture which you find there, and then treat that area with what is needed and consolidate the place.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter LIII.
De curacio de cranc.	On the Treatment of Ulcers.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already stated, in the division, about the types of ulcers and in what manner they are treated with medicines, and that it is necessary for their treatment by hand so that they do not become ulcerated; and we have discussed ulcers generated in the manner and caution of their cure.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients would say that sometimes crain [cancer] is in a place where it is possible to eradicate it, just as with crain which is in the breasts or in the armpits and similar parts assigned to remove all of that, especially when it begins small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and hard, there is no need for me to deal with it, because I cannot heal anyone from that, nor have I seen another who could, nor has anyone reached such a stage.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation on it is when it is necessary, as we have said, that you precede and leave the patient and purge from black bile several times, and then let them bleed if there is obvious congestion.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then prepare the patient for preparation in which the operation is located, and then apply hooked instruments that are necessary for it; and then incise completely with a good scalpel for excision so that there remains no cause for recurrence of it.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow, and do not apply poultices to it hastily, and press the areas, and remove the thick blood with your hand or with an instrument that is suitable among the instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if it is contrary to you to cut thick blood from a vein or artery, then cauterize that until the flow of blood ceases, and then treat it with other methods until it is healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter 56.
De curacio de ydropici.	On the Treatment of Hydrophobia.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recommended, in the division, on the types of hydrophobia from water, and the signs of each type, and the treatment of it with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	Of her who is treated with iron there is only the type of wound alone, and it is not approximated with iron to the type of tympanites nor to the type of hypochondria, for that is fatal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have already treated this type of hydroptic tympanites with medicines and do not confirm your treatment, now consider whether the sick person has become weakened or is suffering from another sickness such as hydroptic, just as if it were coughs or other chest conditions similar to these. Now guard yourself that you do not treat them with iron, for there is fear regarding this.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the sick person is robust in health, and in him there is no other sickness but hydroptic alone, and neither child nor old person, then the method of the operation on him is that you lift the patient between your hands, and have the minister approach and squeeze his belly with his hand, expelling the water from below the navel, and afterward take a sharp probe in this manner:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	it should be of two sharp points long, with a sharp end like a probe; but it should have some slight curvature little by little, so that in the operation you do not pass into the bowel and thereby injure him.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider if the origin of the hydroptic condition is from the bowels, for then it is necessary that in the incision you distance yourself from the navel by the amount of three fingers at each side, directly over the navel.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the origin of the hydroptic condition is from disease of the kidneys, then your incision should be to the left of the navel by three fingers.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation of it is from the gall, then your incision must be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And it is not necessary for your incision to be on the side where the patient wants to lie down because this would cause the superfluities to rush to that place, which would be harmful.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then perforate with the instrument all of the gallbladder, and then insert into that section, and raise your hand between the gallbladder and the duct, and you will extract it; and if the quantity is that of one fingernail or so.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then perforate the duct so that it reaches an empty space, which is where the fluid will drain.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then extract that and insert an instrument which has the following form:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is similar to a thin silver cannula; it is made of silver or ivory or lion leather, at the lower part of which there is a small hole, and on the sides there are three holes: two from one side and one from the other side; and the tip of it is cut like a feather, as you can see.
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the upper end of it is a ring, because when the instrument reaches the fluid, you should immediately stop using it so that only a moderate amount of fluid is evacuated, for if you evacuate too much in one go, the patient may die from resolution of their vital spirit, or it could lead to imminent death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But evacuate it according to the strength of the patient and according to how their condition, the quality of their pulse, and their overall state indicate to you.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	Here is the translation:
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	After the previous day's use, clean the instrument with water if the patient can tolerate it, and extract a small amount of it from the water, and let this continue for several days out of caution, and be careful not to run out of water except in small amounts.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	If you are concerned about the patient, and they use a large amount of water, now bury them in fine sand and sprinkle moisture over them like bathing, and let them be exposed to the sun for a long time; and treat them with drying medicines until they are healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And apply cautery to the stomach, and treat the chest and abdomen after the extraction of water, as I have recounted in what precedes.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	On the treatment of children who are born with unopened passages for urine.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes a child is born from the mother's womb with the head of its mixture not perforated (or it is obstructed or not in place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore, as soon as the child is born, one should use a fine instrument to make a puncture for it in this manner:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then insert a fine lead needle into the obstruction and secure it, leaving it in place for three days or four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when the child needs to urinate, remove the instrument and allow urination; then return the instrument.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not insert the lead, it is possible that the urine which flows over the area will not clear this obstruction.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	May that part where the wound is tight be treated with a lead nail, as we have said, for so many days until it is enlarged.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	May those in whom the wound is not in its place be treated as mentioned, and the cause of this is that which is born with the wound below the tip of the penis so that it cannot urinate normally; therefore, he raises the penis with his hand from above. And it is not for generation, because thus the sperm cannot reach the major second rectitude, and it is a chronic illness.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the method of the operation in this case is that the patient lies on his back, and then extend the tip of the penis with your left hand forcefully. Incise the head of the penis at the location of the foreskin with a sharp scalpel, as if cutting a feather or shaving some part so that the middle part of it resembles the head of the penis and the wound falls in its proper place accordingly.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And be careful in your operation to stop the bleeding, as such incidents may occur; and pause at that point where you cut off the blood flow, and treat the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter LVI.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	On the swelling that occurs in the foreskin at the head of the penis, and on its corruption, blackness, and adherence of the foreskin to the head of the penis.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Such occurrences often happen with this swelling in the penis and it is a chronic flesh prominence.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And one of these is malignant and the other is non-malignant.
