E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	In that action, when there is no bandage, find a dressing, honey which you have cooked so that it thickens, and use it; or take myrrh and aloes and sprinkle them, and grind over the honey which is on the fire, and immediately apply this to cloth and strengthen that upon the joint; and apply this with the honey which you have cooked so that it thickens, and sprinkle over cloth and strengthen that.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes it is administered with the root of aristolochia longa and seeds of lily (and lily celestial) and flour of oats and centaury, and use those simples or adjust them, sprinkle these and sift and powder over the honey which I have recommended; and use this.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the joint is prolonged and has not been healed by this treatment, then you will know that the corruption is in its bone, and it affects the bones or other hard members or the ligaments; now treat it with a fistulous cure, as mentioned above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	On the treatment of paronychia and cracked nails, and the incision of an additional finger and sectioning.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Paronychia is an abscess that arises beside the nail of a finger on the hand or foot, and it can also occur in other fingers. When it becomes prolonged, its treatment is more difficult; it may be an abscess from cautery, or it may become corrupted, and it discharges pus which corrodes the root of the nail, and very quickly corrupts all of it, and often spreads its corruption to the bone causing a foul odor, and the extremity of the finger becomes deformed, and its color turns blackish.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And when you have that as we have said in the division and your treatment does not confine itself to it, then it is necessary that you incise with a knife all the superfluous tissue that is decayed from the nail and immediately cauterize the wound in that area, for cauterization is beneficial in such cases.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is sound and the tendon is healthy, and the divisions of the tendon are already closed by the flesh around them, and they begin to press upon it with pain and distress, then you should pause and cut a thin incision along the angle of the tendon where it presses on the flesh, and push that tendon up, and dissect that flesh easily, and wait over what remains of the flesh with corrosive medicines until it is completely removed; and afterwards cure that wound until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	If the corruption has already begun in the bone, then you should dissect that bone and extract it, for it is never healed when the bone is corrupted.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you find the corrosion and corruption spreading to the finger, then you should dissect it at one of its joints according to where the pain is felt, and afterwards cure it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	If the tendon is affected by contusion or inflammation, and there is severe pain in that area, then at the beginning you should perform venesection on the patient, and afterwards dry the tendon with a sharp spatula in a transverse cut from above to below, and be careful that the incision does not reach into the flesh behind the tendon, for this would cause intense pain to the patient, and it would result in excessive scar tissue forming in the area; and afterwards treat that place with something that alleviates pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But in the case of a swollen finger, which occurs in many people, it is often very fleshy, and there is little flesh on the bones, or it is often in the tendon.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them originate at the root of the joint, or the swelling is in some of the joints of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	He who is born with weak joints in his fingers will not suffer much, and he who is born with strong joints in them suffers little.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those who are born with fleshy parts, the section is easier, and you should cauterize that which you have dissected with a hot spatula.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But for he who is born with the joint in a delicate state, the cure is difficult; and therefore be careful not to cut it.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But in he who is born with loose fingers, it is necessary that you cauterize the flesh at the beginning with a round cautery down to the bone, and then use one of those saws suitable for this purpose, and afterwards treat what is inside until it heals.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	But for consolidation that occurs between the bones either by repeated strain or by the nature of the person born with it, or by consolidation of a wound or by burning from fire, or similarly, then you should section that consolidation until the said parts return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And then place between the layers of the wound in rose oil so that they do not consolidate too quickly, and separate them, or place between them a thin sheet of lead until it is properly consolidated.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly, if consolidation occurs in any of them on the palm, you should then section that consolidation according to how it is prepared and suits the shape of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of cautery for veins, these are the varieties.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins are those that are thick and full of melancholic humors, which move through the limbs of the body, and their greatest occurrence is in the legs, especially in the legs of travelers, workers, and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then it happens that you administer purge for the black cholera several times with strong expulsion, and shortly afterward let blood from the patient's basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The cure for them with iron is according to two methods: one is that it be incised and the black blood be drawn out, and the other method is that the vein be raised and all of it be extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The section of the wound is according to this method: embrocate at the beginning with hot water mixed in such a way that the thick blood becomes resolved, which is like sediment in the poultice, and then tightly bind the poultice on the most prominent part of the wound below the navel with a bandage, and then cauterize the vein in one place, or two, or three with wide incisions, and then draw out the black blood with your hand below the poultice upwards and downwards until the quantity of blood is removed as you wish and as much as suffices, and which the patient's strength can endure.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bandage it, and command him to abstain from foods that generate black cholera.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And iterate the treatment by phlebotomy when the veins are full and inform the patient about this.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But the elevation of them is according to this method: you shave the poultice area of the patient if there are any hairs on it, and then put him in a bath and embrocate the poultice with hot water until it reddens and the veins become prominent; or exercise him vigorously with exercise if a bath is not available, until the limb becomes warm.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	For the operation to expose the windpipe, cut along the side of the vein by incision either in front or behind it, or lower down you should cut at the angle.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	To operate on the windpipe with hooks and scrape the vein from all parts until it appears to the touch, and you should observe its appearance as it turns black in that place.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And so when you open it, you will see the white part which is the membrane.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	Then you should insert the thread where it is raised and displaced from the windpipe, and suspend it with hooks.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	Then make another incision near that incision by three fingers, and then scrape the windpipe above the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then lift that and incise it in the rear section where the angle is, and then extract it and lift it until it comes out through the second incision, and then extract it from the incision above that.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	Then do this until you extract it from the incision that is highest or most distant from all the incisions, until everything comes out; and now you can close the incisions.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you cannot manage to extract and lift it, now insert a strong double-threaded needle and tie it and extract it, or insert the thread below and rotate your hand in all directions until it is expelled.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	Be careful not to cut it; for if it is broken, it will be difficult for you to lift that piece, and the patient will suffer harm from that injury.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when all that is done, then pause upon the place of the wound a cloth submerged in wine and rose oil and non-rose oil, and care for it until it be healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the vessel is contracted with twists to which there is a covering in the parts, and it is not straight as we have said, then you must cut along each twist of it and at the places where it is covered, and immediately suspend it with hooks until you elevate it entirely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And be careful in your section that you do not incise the vein and that you do not injure it, for it will be difficult for you to elevate it; and use your prudence in this.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Shape of the incision with which the vessel is severed:
Forma de unci orp:	Shape of curved hooks:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not made sharp like the hooks nor with a pointed end so that it does not injure the vein; and it should be of thick flexibility, like lion's sinew, for if it were slender, it would cut the vein because of its slenderness; however, it should be in excess of thickness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the extraction of the leg vein.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is found in camels in warm lands such as in Al-Ategi in the land of Arabs and in the warm, dry lands of India where no grass or vegetation grows.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And similarly, it is found in other parts of the body apart from the camel.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its generation is from putrefaction beneath the skin, just as worms and vermin come forth within the bodies of serpents, scorpions, and other creatures generated between the skin and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	Here is the translation:
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	Then when it appears at the opening, you should wrap around that a piece of lead weighing one dram, and about two drams in length, and attach that and let the lead hang from the wound.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as you apply it to the parts externally, wrap that in lead and attach it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it is elongated, then you should incise a part of it and wrap the remaining part; and do not incise that until it has come out externally, for if you incise that which is contracted it will go into the flesh and cause an abscess, corruption, and a bad ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Therefore, it must be treated gently and extracted little by little until it is completely removed from the body and there remains no cause for concern in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And in some people, this vein extends to about five palms in length, and I have heard that it has reached up to twenty palms in length.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised at the time of its treatment, then insert the probe into the tract and perforate that along the tract through the body until all that is in the material is evacuated, and administer putrefaction to the area with medicines for several days; and subsequently treat that as you would an abscess.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has branches, especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or on the foot, and it comes out through multiple openings, with each branch coming out from a separate opening.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And thus treat that as we have said in the division and according to what has been mentioned above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of cutting above worms generated under the skin and it is called bovine illness.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This illness is called in some lands bovine disease because often it happens among cows and it is a worm of which one is born between the skin and the flesh, and moves throughout the body up and down, and is shown through sensation because of its movement from limb to limb until it breaks the skin and comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is from the putrefaction of some humors, just as happens with worms and serpents and earthworms and roundworms in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared because of its malice, for when it moves in the body and rises to the head, and reaches the brain, then suddenly it lightens within and enters and destroys the brain, which often happens.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And when you want to cure that and extract it, then it is not done except according to the movement and appearance of it to sensation. Then tie what is above it and what is below it tightly with bandages and constriction, and afterwards dry over it and extract that.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it penetrates into the flesh and you do not find it, then you should apply cauterization with fire over the area where it is. The main cause that is feared is corruption of it by which it corrupts the area as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	And if you see it reaching the head near the brain, then tie above the eyebrow with strong constriction, and afterwards dry over it, and extract that; and it is necessary for the patient to use purification of their body with medicines evacuating bad putrid humors, and guard against foods generating putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	On incision for inflammation of the uvula.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This illness is called in our land nafir, and it is pain that comes to certain members of the body, and it changes from one member to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And now I will describe it as I am about to recount to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to attend to a sick woman in a village, and when I uncovered her arm, I saw a small inflammation in the funis vein of the arm. And after it had been ruptured for about an hour, I saw that this inflammation moved just as quick as wax would rise, but more quickly than one might expect, like living silver flowing from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then the pain moved from that location and settled in the muscle, and it stayed there for about an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it moved to the other side of the body until it reached the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then she told me that it was revolving throughout her body as I had observed, and I was greatly amazed by its change and the speed with which it moved from one member to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had seen this before in my own patients in that manner, but I have never witnessed such pain being transferred from one member to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I did not see this in my patients as I did in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not think it could be this way except that the woman was of weak constitution, with delicate limbs and exposed veins, in which this wind-like sensation appeared to change.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	It is necessary that there does not appear according to this rear curvature in those who are delicate and of thin human veins weakened.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And when you want the treatment for it, and the patient feels that pain, at that moment it does not appear to be as we have said, at that moment you strengthen over that area and lift it gently so that the trapped air is expelled, and cauterize the area.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it with your own eyes, then treat that by evacuating the body and expelling air, and apply remedies to remove foul pills and pills of saffron and similar substances.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Of the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are varied according to their types and the parts of the body where they strike, for their diversity is such that some have large tips, others small, some concave, others blunt; and among them there are solid ones; those with three angles, and those with tongues; and those which are like spears.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the members and the parts in which they strike is according to two methods: for the members or principal members such as concavities, such as the brain, heart, and spine, lungs, ribs, bowels, bladder, and similar parts; therefore, when you hit one of these members and it appears to you as signs of death, which cause I will recount shortly, then it is necessary that you avoid extracting that arrow from those in whom death approaches quickly due to the major dispositions. And when no such bad signs appear to you and the arrow is not hidden in the depth of the member, then you extract that one and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the signs of the head are when it falls upon the arrow, and passes through the bone, and exits from the brain which is above the head, for it happens by the soda vehement, and scotoma, and vertigo, and rigor in the eyes, and inflammation and rigor of the tongue, and spasm and mixture of understanding and vomiting of bile, and easily cut off is speech, and destroyed is voice, and exits from the place of the plague moisture white like dust, and there are of it wetness to the appearance as of flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore if these signs appear to you, then abstain from treatment and extraction of the arrow, unless it is outside.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of the arrow when it falls into the heart, so that it is near the left breast, and feels there where it is fixed in hard tissue, not soft; and easily the movement of the arrow is like the movement of the pulse, and draws black thick blood from the wound, and dries that coldness of the extremities, and cold sweat; therefore you know that death approaches soon.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has wounded the lung, spewing frothy blood from the wound, and the vessels near the neck are swollen, and the color of the patient changes, and he exhales great breath, and demands a craving for cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow falls on the membrane which is in the thighs, and the pain then is near the small ribs, and it causes great and violent pain and sighing, and there is no strength at all in all the members of the muscles.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrow falls on the stomach, then very quickly there will be from the wound undigested food.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if the arrow is in the belly, and it is fixed within it, make some incision in the wound, or the tissue, or the intestine which is disrupted, and there is no hope for the cure of the arrow's removal.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow strikes in the bladder, and it comes out with urine, and processes for some reason to the parts outside, and suddenly there is pain over the injury, then you know that it is fatal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	But the other members as well, such as in the face, the neck, and the jaw, and the shoulders and the helpers, and the vertebrae of the back, and the collarbone, and the ribs and similar parts of the limbs, are saved according to the best dispositions when the arrow does not hit a vein or artery and is not a venomous arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I recount this to you as I have seen regarding the nature of these arrows, so that you may understand through this about your own treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause is that in a person who was struck by an arrow in the lacrimal bone near the root of the nose, I removed it from the other side, left the gray matter of the ear alone, and he healed without damage to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I removed another arrow from a Jew who was struck in the gray matter of his eye. After leaving the eyelid intact, the arrow was already hidden and only a small part of it could be grasped to which its shaft adhered. It was a large sharp arrow of the Turks, made of iron like a lion's tooth, which had no barbs.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew healed, and no harm came to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	About removing an arrow from a Christian man who had been shot in the groin, and it was an Arabian arrow, which has barbs; then I made an incision between two grooves, and it was already submerged under his skin there; then I carefully extracted that, and the Christian man recovered.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I removed another arrow from a man who had been shot in his abdomen, and he was thought to die because of it; and so, after thirty days had passed and there were no changes regarding his condition, I made an incision on the arrow and extracted it, and he recovered, and did not suffer any further complications.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw a man in whom an arrow had penetrated between his two thighs, and the wound had become consolidated on him, and after seven years, the arrow was exposed at the root of the thigh.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman in whom an arrow had penetrated her abdomen, and the wound had consolidated within her, and there were no changes regarding her condition, and the woman did not suffer any harm in performing any of her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man in whom an arrow had penetrated his face, and the wound had consolidated, and he broke the arrow without feeling any pain, and many similar cases are like this.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I removed the arrow from the prince of the king who had been shot in the middle of his nose, and it had already shifted slightly to the right, and the entire arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called for his treatment regarding the embedding of the arrow within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	Then I examined the wound of the finger with a narrow probe; then I probed it carefully but did not feel anything there; however, she felt pain below her right ear, and then I hoped that that point was at the end of the finger.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I applied a plaster to the place with an emplastrature in which there is a virtue attractive and digestive, confident that the place would reveal itself to me so that I could see the location of the finger, because it would adhere to that.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And no significant accident occurred at the site where the finger had come to rest; and I continued with the plaster on it for several days without any incident; and as the wound healed, after some days I felt the finger move within its socket and reported this to myself.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	Then I applied acute corrosive medicine to the wound for several days until it became hot, and with a probe I probed that area, and found the end of the finger delicately adhering to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then I adjusted the appearance of the wound with that acute medicine until the end of the finger became visible to me, and it took me four months to reach this stage.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And when the wound had become sufficiently enlarged, and it was possible for me to introduce forceps into it, I did so but without success. Then I ceased to attempt further manipulations by other means, until one day I began to use methods of extraction with forceps carefully made, as will be shown in the form at the end of this chapter, from which I extracted it; and then I restored the wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some surgeons judge that the cartilage of the nose is not restored, and I have restored it and the wound has been consolidated, and the patient has been healed entirely, and there was nothing else to be done for him.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recommend to you the quality of extracting some arrows, so that you may apply this rule and explanation to what I have not mentioned, for the parts of this art and the definitions thereof are not understood in narrative alone nor do they comprehend those who read the book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the wise craftsmen compare with few words; and in what is present about what is absent; and when accidents occur, they should discover new operations and new instruments for the descent of strange causes from the art.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore I say that arrows are not extracted from the members in which they are lodged except in two ways: either by attraction to the place where they intersect; or by the opposite of the other part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is extracted by the place where it entered, or is an arrow proceeding in soft tissue, and is drawn out and removed.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not obey this advice about the time when you catch it, then wait some days before removing it so that the flesh around it may heal and become accustomed to its presence and its removal.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly, if it is lodged in bone and you do not follow this advice, then leave it for several days and gradually move it according to its attraction and motion each day, and then it can be safely removed.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if you do not follow this advice for several days, then it is necessary that you perforate around the arrow in that bone from all sides with a fine drill until the space around the arrow is enlarged, and then remove it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is embedded in the bone of the head and has penetrated into one of the ventricles of the brain, and any of those symptoms which I have mentioned appear in the patient, then at this time refrain from extracting the arrow and leave it inside until its natural course takes place over a few days; for if it reaches the heart, death is not thereby prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not embedded except in the bone itself and does not penetrate into the heart, and the patient remains stable for several days without any of those symptoms occurring, then you should devise a way to extract the arrow and do so.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is embedded and you do not proceed with extraction, then you should administer treatments around the arrow as we have recommended, and take care of the area until it heals.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow is hidden in the body's location and is out of reach, then you should probe around there, and if you feel it, then grasp it with some instruments that are suitable for extracting it.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot reach it due to the constriction of the wound and the length of the shaft, and there is neither bone nor nerve nor vein here, then enlarge the wound until it is possible to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if it is attached to the ears along with them, then you should remove the flesh in which it is embedded completely with all the skill that you can; and proceed with this, if you cannot do so by avoiding cutting through the flesh in fracturing the ears and twisting them until you are able to.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you perform the extraction of the arrow in whatever place it may be, then you use both a twist of your hand and forceps to all parts so that it obeys; and carefully with great care that the arrow is not broken and that it is made difficult for you and for its extraction.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot do this at that time, then leave it for several days until the parts around it become firm, and then try again when it is easier.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if there is contrary bleeding, then you administer what we have said about treatment in the respective chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And guard your virtue from cutting into veins or nerves, or tendons, and administer care in every possible way to avoid the arrow; and do this with ease, calmness, slowness, and firmness as I advise and recommend.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore, make the arrow straight so that the patient is in accordance with the figure according to which you should determine the extraction of the arrow from it, for this is more beneficial.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	But if this is not possible for you, then administer what is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	But arrows that are driven in from the opposite side, or that you have already processed some part of them to the outer parts, or if the extremity of the arrow causes swelling due to pressure from the bone above and raises it; then you should cut into that area. Make the incision according to the amount by which the forceps grasp it; and then pull it out, for it will be easy to do so in this manner.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	If a bone is held in the wound, then place it straight according to its opposite part until the arrow presses into the bone, and enlarge it thus, and then extract that one.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if not, leave it for several days, and then try to extract it when there is less inflammation.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the arrow is there, then push it out from there.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	But if the shaft has fallen in and you want to administer impulse, then insert and use it, if it is blunt, a hollow instrument so that it enters the cavity of it into the base of the arrow and then push it out from there.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is convex, then push it out with a strong instrument entering into it, for the arrow is lightened by that.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is poisoned, then ensure that you hollow out all the flesh in which it is embedded, if it is possible for you to do so, and then treat it with what is appropriate.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow hits the feet, or the abdomen, or the bladder, or the side, and is close so that you touch it with your finger, and it is possible for you to cut above it, then cut above it and guard against cutting into a vein or nerve, and extract it, and then treat the wound as needed, and cure it until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Form of forceps with which arrows are pulled:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Let the extremities of these be shaped like the beak of a bird, which are made like pincers so that they do not let go of the arrow.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	Of those, various types are made large, few and medium-sized, according to the quantity of the arrow's size and the smallness of the sinew, and the width of the wound, and the constriction of it.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	The impelling concavity of this extremity is curved like an owl's feather so that the instrument of the arrow may be glided into it, and the impulse of that blunt part:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Form of the impelling blunt extremity:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	like an arrow so that the instrument may be glided into its concave arrow and is propelled by that.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	About the incision of the veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins for phlebotomy of which the custom is to perform phlebotomy at xxx, of which in the head sixteen, two pulsating veins which are near the ears, called alhasisain; two herbs that appear on both temples; and two veins that are in the two tear ducts of the eyes which are called aspicientz; and the prepared vein in the middle of the forehead, and the vein that is at the tip of the nose; and two glands that are on the neck; and two veins that are on the upper lip; and two veins that are on the lower lip; and these are the veins that are called algelic; and there are two veins below the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	The veins that are phlebotomized in the arms are five; among those is one cephalic, and it runs along the wild chestnut tree; and the people call it "the vein of the head," blunt, and it is a medium-sized vein, and it consists of a branch of the basilica, and another branch of the cephalic; and they name that by the people "vein of the whole body," and basilica is the vein which lies on the domestic chestnut tree, and is called "citillar," and they call that one the vulgar "vein of the abdomen"; and the funis of the arm, and it lies over the elbow, and it is in this where phlebotomy is performed, and it appears above the wrist by manifest appearance; and salvatella, and it is the vein which is between the thumb and the little finger, and it runs on both sides.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And on the thigh and in the groin there are three veins; one of them is behind the curve of the tailbone of the wild animal; and the second is sophena, and its place is behind the groin of the domestic animal; and the vena sciatica, and its place is behind the groin of the wild animal; and in the groin there are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The treatment of the veins that are near the ears is for catarrhs, antitics, hemorrhages, and old ulcers of the head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of treating those veins is as I recommend to you: shave the patient's head, and rub the patient’s head in the occipital area where both veins are with a large piece of cloth for good friction; then tighten the patient's hair with a bandage so that the two veins become visible near the ears at two lower points on the head; and press them with your thumb, and if you feel the pulse of those veins with your finger here, this is how you should proceed.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then take the scalpel, and it should be sharp, and then insert it behind the vein into the bone until the blood flow reaches the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then raise your hand with the vein and the bone towards the upper parts and incise the vein with a sharp incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And let the length of the incision be the quantity of two fingers or around that amount; and let out as much blood as you wish.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then apply pressure with poultices and leave it until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And there is mentioned at the beginning of the book the incision of those and their cautery.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	But of the two arteries, for the Templars the benefit of phlebotomy is to remove an ancient and persistent evil and frequent ophthalmia and acute effusions in the eyes.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of phlebotomizing those veins is as I recommend to you: have the patient sit and put your hand under their arm so that the two veins appear clearly by sight, and feel the pulse below with your fingers; then at this time attempt it.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And then raise the tourniquet above the vein towards your hand with your finger, and insert the phlebotomy instrument below, and raise the vein up; and incise it as you have done with the other two veins; and let the blood flow according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then loosen the patient's restraint, and place your hand on the vein for an hour, and afterwards apply a bandage and powder over it with strong compression, and leave it until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And there is mentioned the description of them, and the incision of those veins, and the attraction at the beginning of the book.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And thus the benefit of phlebotomy of the frontal vein is similar to the phlebotomy of the cephalic vein for ancient diseases of the face and headache, stiffness, and foul-smelling ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of phlebotomy on it is as I recommend to you: the patient should hold their arm with a bandage so that the vein appears; then take the instrument called a fleam, which has this form:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Pause the punctures at the point which is at the head of the furrow above that vein and strike it from either side or for some other reason in that manner, and let the blood flow according to the quantity you wish; and then remove the perforation of the patient and bind up that area until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	And in some cases, a femoral vein incision is made, but it does not need to be of sharp extremity like the other vein incisions; rather, it should be blunt-ended, and make that incision transversely, because the bone is close by and strong, and the incision might easily break through if it were too fine.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	May the treatment of the two veins that are near the tear ducts of both eyes be used for eye itchiness due to irritation and grease in the eyes, as well as for illnesses of the face.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And the quality of the venesection is that the patient should hold their arm with a bandage, and then perform those incisions, while you stand above the head of the patient.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And the venesection should be made transversely along a bit above or below the vein, where there is little flesh; and if the incision is fine, the tip of it might easily break through.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then let the blood flow as much as is necessary for you, and pause when it reaches that point, and bind those areas for one night, and then remove them.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	And the venesection of the vein of the nose is suitable for acute fever and violent headache, and for illnesses of the face and migraine and pain that occurs in the face, especially when they are chronic.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	Of the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient strains his neck and brings it near to his nose with your left hand, and take the lancet sharp long and put it in the middle place of the nose tip according to straightness, for the vein does not appear to the sense here, and for the blood begins to flow soon.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Move your hand with the small lancet little by little and make the blood flow according to your need; and then leave it for one night, for it is quickly restored.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	The harm of phlebotomy on the two veins leads to constriction of them and to the beginning of leprosy and to many diseases and impetigo and bad corrosive ulcers as well as herpes.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	The quality of the phlebotomy of those is that the patient strains each one with his neck; and the surgeon stands over the head of the patient, and the patient sits on a chair.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	And then phlebotomize the vein with a long lancet and a broad small one little by little; and then extract blood according to season, quantity, or according to what you find necessary for that; and then do the same for the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And then loosen the ligature and compress the two veins gently with a moderate constriction so that the patient is not overly constricted, and let it be done in the morning as the plague is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the harm of phlebotomy of the large veins applies to small abscesses and pustules in the mouth and corruption of the gums and bad ulcers and cracks, and to bad ulcers that are inside the nose and around it.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	Of the quality of phlebotomy is that you make the patient sit before you, and tie a bandage around his neck, and then roll back his lips and look at two veins of which one is on the right side of the lip and the second on the left; and the demonstration of each is by the darkness of each of them, and this more so because in the vicinity of those veins there are small black ones; and then you cut each with a cutting incision.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	If doubt is present in you and you do not know which one it is, then you should make an incision in the larger of them, and in the more apparent of them.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make the appearance of the two veins that are on the upper lip.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	However, it is customary to cut more often the two veins that are on the lower lip.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	But of the two veins that are below, the tongue is often near the phlebotomy of the cephalic artery for precautions that are in the throat, to the illness of the uvula, and to illnesses of the mouth.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	And the quality of phlebotomizing those veins is that you place the patient between your hands in front of the light, and lift up his tongue, and look below the tongue, on one side of the vein and on the other side a vein, and the color of each tends towards blackness.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And then phlebotomize each one; and be careful not to penetrate too deeply when phlebotomizing them, for below those are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the veins that are phlebotomized in the bend usually occur in all men, and the phlebotomy of theirs is done according to two methods, either place on the phlebotomy site a small round object like a blueberry or olive with subtlety; or use a scalpel for phlebotomy, and test if it hurts, and this is the form of it:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this is what is suitable for sectioning and of those very thin and subtle ones according to the width of the veins and according to the constriction of those.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Method of millet-sized venesection:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Let the incisions be made as described, and it is suitable to open the concave full veins with obvious thick stems, and those that contain thick coagulated blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the method of olive-sized venesection:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this venesection is of lesser width and more subtle extremity, and it is suitable for venesection of thin veins that contain fine, thin blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	But the benefit of the venesection of the basilica vein, which is one of three veins: for it extracts blood from diseases below the jaw and the neck, and from what affects the legs and the abdomen.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it is suitable for the phlebotomist, when performing venesection on that vein, to be very careful with it and have great fear of it, because near it there is an artery. If he errs in the puncture of the venesection, he will cut that artery and cause a gushing of blood. Therefore, one should not perform venesection on that vein with a sharp instrument but rather with a cutting blade like a knife.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilica vein does not appear by obvious means, then you should leave that one and switch to another, or seek some branch of it. Or perform venesection at the end of the arm where it is apparent; and section that vein with a knife for venesection as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	If you want to perform phlebotomy on the arm, then place your hand above the constriction of the arm until you know the location of the pulse, and then slightly further; and then hold the arm steady and incise the vein with a concave cut as we have said; and be careful not to strike the artery in any part of its location.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see it, as you tighten the ligature, inflation occurs in the place that you marked slightly further, then that inflation is arterial swelling, and therefore avoid that area.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flow from the phlebotomy as it does in a child's urine, and the blood is fine and red, then you know that it is arterial blood; and then you continue and pause your hand on that for some time; and then remove your hand, and if the bleeding has stopped after several moments, then tighten the arm and leave that area.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And protect the patient from the misuse of it, and be overly cautious with it and do not use that area for several days until it is healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	And if the bleeding does not stop, and you do not have medical assistance available, then you should incise the artery if it appears to you; because the extremity of it is contracted, and the blood has stopped; or take a piece of cloth, and fold that, and place one half tightly over the vein with a ligature and with powders on the other day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And if the bleeding has stopped, that is good; and if not, then treat that with what is prescribed for stopping the flow of blood from the veins.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	The removal of the bone in many cases is difficult due to the small location of the wound and the possibility of bandaging the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But for the dark vein, phlebotomy is a method that extracts blood from the upper part of the head and the lower part of the body; by this means, which is composed of branches of the basilica and branches of the cephalic vein, as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And it is important for the phlebotomist to be overly cautious during the phlebotomy of this area because below that lies a nerve; and then if there is an error in the puncture of the phlebotomy and the nerve is hit, it will cause numbness, and healing from this is difficult, and rarely is one fully healed.
